  • Method Details

    • addPart

      public void addPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      When the Add button is clicked underneath the Parts' table view; this method is called, and it initializes the addPart view.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action event passed in by clicking the button. This is used to recycle the current scene.
      Throws:
      IOException - throw an IOException if javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader.load throws one.
      See Also:
      • The scene gets passed off to the AddPart controller class.

    • addProduct

      public void addProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      When the Add button is clicked underneath the Products' table view; this method is called, and it initializes the addProduct view.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action event passed in by clicking the button. This is used to recycle the current scene.
      Throws:
      IOException - throw an IOException if javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader.load throws one.
      See Also:
      • The scene gets passed off to the AddProduct controller class.

    • modifyPart

      public void modifyPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      When the Modify button is clicked underneath the Parts' table view; this method is called, and it initializes the modifyProduct view with data from the selected Part.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action event passed in by clicking the button. This is used to recycle the current scene.
      See Also:
      • The scene and data get passed off to the ModifyPart controller class.

    • modifyProduct

      public void modifyProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      When the Modify button is clicked underneath the Products' table view; this method is called; and it initializes the modifyProduct view with data from the selected Product - which uses the ModifyProduct controller class.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action event passed in by clicking the button. This is used to recycle the current scene.
      See Also:
      • The scene and data get passed off to the ModifyProduct controller class.

    • deletePart

      public void deletePart()
      Gets a selected Part in the Parts' table view, and removes that Part from the allParts observable arrayList. If no part is selected, a dialog notifies the user and requests for them to make a selection using main.Main.showDialog. Otherwise, it confirms whether the user really wants to delete a part using main.Main.confirmationDialog before actually deleting the part.

    • deleteProduct

      public void deleteProduct()
      Gets a selected Product in the Products' table view, and removes that Product from the allProducts observable arrayList. If no product is selected, a dialog notifies the user and requests for them to make a selection using main.Main.showDialog. Otherwise, it confirms whether the user really wants to delete a product using main.Main.confirmationDialog before actually deleting the product.

    • searchPart

      public void searchPart()
      The searchPartField TextField takes in a String that represents either an integer, the partial name of a Part, or the whole name of a Part. This method first tries to convert the String to an integer and search for a part based on its partID number. If that fails; a NumberFormatException will be thrown, so it will simply search for the part based on its partial or entire name.

    • searchProduct

      public void searchProduct()
      The searchProductField TextField takes in a String that represents either an integer, the partial name of a Product, or the whole name of a Product. This method first tries to convert the String to an integer and search for a product based on its productID number. If that fails; a NumberFormatException will be thrown, so it will simply search for the Product based on its partial or entire name.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes this controller when the FXMLLoader's load method is called.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      See Also:
      • The initialize method overrides the one in the Initializable interface.
